section.title: Gerunds and infinitives
section.sectiontitle: When one verb follows another verb, the second verb is sometimes the gerund (-ing) and sometimes the infinitive.
section.text2a: I want to see that new film.
section.sectiontitle2: Common verbs followed by the gerund are enjoy, avoid, imagine, consider, finish, miss.
section.text3a: I can't imagine going to the moon.
section.text4a: Would you consider working part time?

section.title: Gerunds and infinitives
section.sectiontitle: Common verbs followed by the infinitive are want, seem, offer, decide, hope, afford, expect, promise.
section.text1a: He decided to start piano lessons.
section.text2a: I'm hoping to go to university next year.
